description: Two rear roof extensions and two roof lights to front roof slope; and raised roof ridge height
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason:  In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers Ordnance Survey Plan scale 1:1250; Existing First Floor ref. RPA/7&8/NC/201; Proposed First Floor ref. RPA/7&8/NC/202; Proposed Loft Level Floor ref. RPA/7&8/NC/203; Elevations ref. RPA/7&8/NC/204; Elevations ref. RPA/7&8/NC/205; Elevations ref. RPA/7&8/NC/206.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing buildings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), SPG 4, policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| The raising of the roof ridge hereby approved shall be carried out simultaneously at Nos. 7 and 8 Newbury Close, Northolt and completed in its entirety.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), SPG 4, policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
